page.title: 18PLACES TO VISIT IN KIRKBY
page.content: Near the centre of the town stands{St. {Mary's Church},which has some pillars and arches dating back to{Norman times.It has been much altered and extended so that one of its more unusual features is that the north aisle is much larger than the south aisle.Through the Churchyard is {Ruskin's View},famous for its spectacular views across the valley of the Lune to the fells beyond.It was called the most beautiful view in England by{John Ruskin,the writer,}and was the subject of the painting by {Turner.}Although high above the Lune, the footpath has caused concern in the last few years as part of it has collasped through{erosion.}Expensive remedial work is urgently required. From here the footpath leads to Kearstwick and Home Farm.
